description: Numbers n such that n remains prime through 4 iterations of function f(x) = 8x + 1.
comments: n, 8*n+1, 64*n+9, 512*n+73 and 4096*n+585 are primes. [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: rp4Q[n_]:=AllTrue[Rest[NestList[8#+1&,n,4]],PrimeQ]; Select[Prime[ Range[ 325000]],rp4Q] (* The program uses the AllTrue function from Mathematica version 10 *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Dec 23 2014 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [1..5000000] | IsPrime(n) and IsPrime(8*n+1) and IsPrime(64*n+9) and IsPrime(512*n+73) and IsPrime(4096*n+585)] [From _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 04 2010]
author: _David W. Wilson_
